definition: brilliant white snow cover (esp. of distant peaks)

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean

sentences.english: A few days later the weather finally cleared, revealing a completely white north face.
sentences.chinese: 數日後，天氣轉好，白雪皚皚的整個北壁一覽無餘。

sentences.english: Here in winter snow, snow mountains everywhere and a piece of white.
sentences.chinese: 這裏的冬天白雪皚皚，到處銀裝素裹，一片潔白。

sentences.english: Japan's Mount Fuji, covered with snow, stands amidst the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 日本富士山，山峯高聳入雲，山巔白雪皚皚。

sentences.english: I am in a thousand winds that blow, Across northreands azeroth.
sentences.chinese: 我是萬千呼嘯的風，飛過白雪皚皚的艾澤拉斯。

sentences.english: The coffin was got out of its rough box and down on the snowy platform.
sentences.chinese: 靈柩從粗笨的大箱子裏搬出，擺在白雪皚皚的月臺上。
下面是白雪皚皚的羣峯。

sentences.english: Snowdon and the mountains beyond were covered in snow.
sentences.chinese: 斯諾頓和遠處的山到處都是白雪皚皚。

sentences.english: Standing in the snow capped peaks, let a person have a kind of feeling of the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 站在白雪皚皚的山峯，讓人有一種騰雲駕霧的感覺。

sentences.english: From the snow-capped Changbai Mountains down to the vast South China Sea frontier.
sentences.chinese: 從白雪皚皚的長白山下到遼闊的南海邊疆。

sentences.english: The snowy main peak towers above all the others.
sentences.chinese: 白雪皚皚的主峯高聳在羣巒之上。

definition: continuous/unbroken/uninterrupted/extending forever into the distance (of mountain range, river etc)
the northern part of the country/the North
not a sound to be heard (idiom)
green grass like cushion (idiom); green meadow so inviting to sleep on
cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
as far as the eye can see (idiom)
